qas.question: In what year did Jedlik begin experimenting with electromagnetism?
Besides the stator and the communicator, what is an element of a DC motor?
What did Jedlik call his earliest devices?
What discovery solved the problem of continuous rotation?
What did Jedlik's improved device eliminate the need for?
In what year did Jedlik begin experimenting with non-electromagnetism?
Besides the stator and the communicator, what is an element of a non-DC motor?
What didn't Jedlik call his earliest devices?
What discovery solved the problem of non-continuous rotation?
What did Jedlik's improved device make the need for?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>1827<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Hungarian physicist Ányos Jedlik started experimenting with electromagnetic coils. After Jedlik solved the technical problems of the continuous rotation with the invention of the <a3_0>commutator<a3_0/>, he called his early devices "<a2_0><b7_0>electromagnetic self-rotors<b7_0/><a2_0/>". Although they were used only for instructional purposes, in 1828 Jedlik demonstrated the first device to contain the three main components of practical DC motors: the stator, <a1_0><b6_0>rotor<b6_0/><a1_0/> and <b8_0>commutator<b8_0/>. The device employed no <a4_0><b9_0>permanent magnets<b9_0/><a4_0/>, as the magnetic fields of both the stationary and revolving components were produced solely by the currents flowing through their windings.
